sentences.sContent: Rosie ran downstairs to answer the door.
Charles was downstairs in the kitchen.
She repainted the downstairs rooms and closed off the second floor.
sentences.sCn: 她重新粉刷了楼下的房间，并把二楼封上了。

trans.tranOther: towards or on a lower floor of a building, especially a house
Downstairs means situated on the ground floor of a building or on a lower floor than you are
the rooms on the ground floor in a house
